comments:
Build: RC1 and 20030224
JDK: Sun JDK 1.4.1

Reproduce:
1. Create a new Java project, and a main class that uses a non-JRE library such
as SWT:
import org.eclipse.swt.SWT;
public class Main {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		System.out.println(SWT.getPlatform());
	}
}

2. In the Project's "Java Build Path" (right-click on it and click Properties),
under the "Libraries" tab, click on "Add Variable..."

3. Select "ECLIPSE_HOME", click "Extend...", and navigate to swt.jar.

4. Click OK, OK, and run the main class as a Java Application.
I get the following:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/SWT
	at Main.main(Main.java:4)
Exception in thread "main" 


Now remove swt.jar from the classpath, and add it as an "External Jar" instead
of an extension to the variable, and rerun the App. It should work this time.

In the launch configurations, everything looks good, but when the launch is done
using the variable, swt.jar is missing from the "-classpath" option on the
command-line.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 32633 ***
